a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This is a draft, with several corrections, of the four-line poem "As I Sit Writing Here," which was published first in the New York Herald, May 14, 1888. It was reprinted in November Boughs (1888) and in the "Sands at Seventy" annex of Leaves of Grass (1891â€“92).

bibl.title: As I Sit Writing Here
bibl.orgName: Manuscripts Division, Department of Rare Books and Special Collections, Princeton University Library
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.head: As I sit thinking writing here

lg.l: As I sit thinking writing here, sick and grown old,
Not my least burden is that dulness ‸of the years, querilities
Ungracious glooms, aches, lethargy, constipation, whimpering ennui,
May filter‸solitude in my daily songs.
